Name: Statue of the queen Nefertari
Description: This limestone statue represents Nefertari, Great Royal Wife of Ramesses II. The head has not been preserved and the torso is badly deteriorated. The left hand of the queen, which probably holds a  menat necklace, is folded across the chest. The inscription engraved on the dorsal pillar carries a hymn to the queen who was assimilated to the goddess Hathor. On the left side of the base of the statue one finds a representation of her son Mery-Atoum, carrying a  flabellum.
